conclusion: Points A, B, and C are liquid release points.
Points D and E are collection containers.
There are colored bars/baffles on the board that will affect the liquid flow.
The liquid will flow downward due to gravity.
Purple baffle is diagonal on the right side.

premise: Purple baffle is diagonal on the right side.
conclusion: Purple baffle will deflect liquid flowing from above it toward the right.
Brown baffle is diagonal on the upper left.

premise: Brown baffle is diagonal on the upper left.
conclusion: Brown baffle will deflect liquid toward the bottom-left.
Yellow baffle is diagonal on the left side.

premise: Yellow baffle is diagonal on the left side.
conclusion: Yellow baffle will deflect liquid toward the bottom-right.
Gray baffle is diagonal on the right side.

premise: Gray baffle is diagonal on the right side.
conclusion: Gray baffle will deflect liquid toward the bottom-left.
Green and orange structures at the bottom are the collection containers D and E.
Liquid drops straight down from A.

premise: Liquid drops straight down from A.
conclusion: Liquid from A will hit the purple baffle and be deflected toward the right.

premise: Liquid from A will hit the purple baffle and be deflected toward the right.
conclusion: After deflection, liquid from A will continue downward toward container E.
Liquid drops straight down from B.

premise: Liquid drops straight down from B.
conclusion: Liquid from B will hit the purple baffle and be deflected toward the right.

conclusion: After deflection, liquid from B will continue downward toward container E.
